definition: word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
form word/in Classical Chinese, the first character of phrase having auxiliary grammatical function

sentences.english: By contrast, almost every Indian has a basic English vocabulary.
sentences.chinese: 反而，几乎每个印度人都了解基本的英语词汇。

sentences.english: The student came along with an English dictionary under his arm.
sentences.chinese: 这名学生腋下夹着一本英语词典走来。

sentences.english: Members are allowed to use English-English dictionaries.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部成员可以用英语词典。

sentences.english: She bought an English dictionary for me.
sentences.chinese: 她给我买了一本英语词典。

sentences.english: Now the VOA Special English program WORDS AND THEIR STORIES.
sentences.chinese: 现在是美国之音慢速英语词汇掌故节目。

sentences.english: Many English words come from abroad.
sentences.chinese: 许多英语词汇是外来语。

sentences.english: Free verse is like free love; it is contradiction in terms.
sentences.chinese: 自由诗好比自由恋爱，那是语词矛盾的说话。

sentences.english: Thousands of English words are derived from Latin.
sentences.chinese: 数以千计的英语词汇源自拉丁语。

sentences.english: You can't make a full command of English words if you depend on mere mechanical memory.
sentences.chinese: 只靠死记单词是不能熟练掌握英语词汇的。

sentences.english: Liu Ping wants his father to buy an English dictionary for him.
sentences.chinese: 刘平想要他父亲给他买一本英语词典。

sentences.english: There are several Yiddish words to describe social misfits.
sentences.chinese: 有好几个依地语词描述社交不适应。

sentences.english: In the beginning was the word’.[14]
sentences.chinese: 所以，创世之初就是语词。

sentences.english: However, the English vocabulary is mainly derived from the IndoEuropean languages.
sentences.chinese: 不过，英语词汇主要还是来源于印欧语系。

sentences.english: Now, the Special English program WORDS AND THEIR STORIES.
sentences.chinese: 现在，这里是美国之音慢速英语词汇掌故节目。

sentences.english: English vocabulary has the nature of arbitrariness and motivation.
sentences.chinese: 英语词汇不但具有非理据性，同时具有非任意性。

sentences.english: I'd like very much to buy the English dictionary.Unfortunately,I haven't got enough money on me.
sentences.chinese: 我很想买这本英语词典，遗憾的是我身上带的钱不够。

definition: word (general term including monosyllables through to short phrases)/term (e.g. technical term)/expression
language component/morpheme/individual characters (making up an expression)
